meanings.definition: To utter the characteristic cry of a rooster.
meanings.sent1: The rooster crowed loudly at dawn.
meanings.sent2: The rooster always crowed to announce the morning.
meanings.sent3: The rooster crowed so loudly, it woke up the whole farm!
meanings.sent4: His voice crowed like a proud rooster in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the rooster crowing echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: He crowed about his victory to everyone.
meanings.sent2: She crowed with joy when she won the game.
meanings.sent3: The little boy crowed happily after finishing his puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter crowed through the room, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The team captain crowed proudly after their big win.

meanings.definition: A group of people or animals.
meanings.sent1: The crowed gathered around the performer.
meanings.sent2: A crowed of fans cheered for their favorite team.
meanings.sent3: The crowed at the zoo was excited to see the new baby animals.
meanings.sent4: The crowed of students rushed out of the school after the bell rang.
meanings.sent5: The crowed of birds filled the sky with their fluttering wings.
